meanings.definition: A small scale model or rough draft of an unfinished sculpture or architectural design.
meanings.sent1: The artist displayed several maquettes of the building before starting the actual construction.
meanings.sent2: Architects often create maquettes to plan their structures before building them.
meanings.sent3: The maquettes of the dinosaur sculptures looked like tiny toys scattered around the studio.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with maquettes of future inventions, each one a glimpse into her creative mind.
meanings.sent5: The maquettes of the city skyline were so detailed, they almost looked real.

meanings.definition: A preliminary sketch or mock-up used to visualize a final product.
meanings.sent1: The designer presented a series of maquettes to the client to choose from.
meanings.sent2: Before painting the mural, the artist first created a maquette to plan the composition.
meanings.sent3: The maquettes of the new logo were so colorful and vibrant, they brightened up the office.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a maquette of ideas waiting to be transformed into reality.
meanings.sent5: The maquettes of the fashion collection gave a sneak peek into the designer's upcoming line.
